metadata.synopsis: Gale's default dialog that triggers whenever you speak to Gale in the game world. Covers a variety of topics that mostly react to Gale-related events that took place.

143.speaker: Gale
143.text: Such was my skill that it earned me the attention of the mother of magic herself. The Lady of Mysteries. The goddess Mystra.
143.context: CinematicNodeContext: The player places their hand on Gale's heart. Idle.NodeContext: Gale kneels down on both knees in front of the player.

72.speaker: Gale
72.text: She revealed herself to me and she became my teacher. In time, she became my muse, and later, even my lover.
72.context: CinematicNodeContext: The player places their hand on Gale's heart. Idle.NodeContext: Gale kneels down on both knees in front of the player.

66.speaker: Player
66.text: Are you telling me you made love to a goddess?
66.context: CinematicNodeContext: The player places their hand on Gale's heart. Idle.NodeContext: Gale kneels down on both knees in front of the player.

6.speaker: Gale
6.context: CinematicNodeContext: The player places their hand on Gale's heart. Idle.NodeContext: Gale kneels down on both knees in front of the player.

115.speaker: Gale
115.text: We enjoyed each other's company - body, mind and soul. But even so, I desired more.
115.context: CinematicNodeContext: The player places their hand on Gale's heart. Idle.NodeContext: Gale kneels down on both knees in front of the player.

82.speaker: Gale
82.text: You see, no matter how powerful a wizard we mortals can become, we never scratch more than the surface of the Weave.
82.context: CinematicNodeContext: The player places their hand on Gale's heart. Idle.NodeContext: Gale kneels down on both knees in front of the player.

48.speaker: Gale
48.text: Mystra keeps us in check. There are boundaries she doesn't let us cross. Yet every time I was with her, I stood on the precipice, gazing into the wonders that lay beyond.
48.context: CinematicNodeContext: The player places their hand on Gale's heart. Idle.NodeContext: Gale kneels down on both knees in front of the player.

67.speaker: Gale
67.text: I sought to cross her boundaries.
67.context: CinematicNodeContext: The player places their hand on Gale's heart. Idle.NodeContext: Gale kneels down on both knees in front of the player.

32.speaker: Player
32.text: How exactly did you try to cross those boundaries?
32.context: CinematicNodeContext: The player places their hand on Gale's heart. Idle.NodeContext: Gale kneels down on both knees in front of the player.

117.speaker: Gale
117.text: I tried to convince her. I pouted, I pleaded, I swore my ambition was only to serve her better. But she only smiled and told me to be contented.
117.context: CinematicNodeContext: The player places their hand on Gale's heart. Idle.NodeContext: Gale kneels down on both knees in front of the player.

4.speaker: Gale
4.text: As inconceivable as it seems to me now, I shared a bed with a goddess and yet I wasn't satisfied. So I sought to prove myself worthy to her instead.
4.context: CinematicNodeContext: The player places their hand on Gale's heart. Idle.NodeContext: Gale kneels down on both knees in front of the player.

83.speaker: Gale
83.text: We come now to the crux of my folly. Shall I share the story behind it, or would you rather head straight to its sordid finale?
83.context: CinematicNodeContext: The player places their hand on Gale's heart. Idle.NodeContext: Gale kneels down on both knees in front of the player.

22.speaker: Player
22.context: CinematicNodeContext: The player places their hand on Gale's heart. Idle.NodeContext: Gale kneels down on both knees in front of the player.

110.speaker: Gale
110.context: CinematicNodeContext: The player places their hand on Gale's heart. Idle.NodeContext: Gale kneels down on both knees in front of the player.

109.speaker: Gale
109.text: Once upon a very long time ago, a mighty lord lived in a tower. A flying tower, to be precise.
109.context: CinematicNodeContext: The player places their hand on Gale's heart. Idle.NodeContext: Gale kneels down on both knees in front of the player.

99.speaker: Gale
99.text: I'll save his history for another time, but the gist of it is that he sought to usurp the goddess of magic so that he could become a god himself.
99.context: CinematicNodeContext: The player places their hand on Gale's heart. Idle.NodeContext: Gale kneels down on both knees in front of the player.

23.speaker: Gale
23.text: He almost managed, but not quite, and his entire empire - Netheril - came crashing down around him as he turned to stone.
23.context: CinematicNodeContext: The player places their hand on Gale's heart. Idle.NodeContext: Gale kneels down on both knees in front of the player.

144.speaker: Gale
144.text: The magic unleashed that day was phenomenal, roiling like the prime chaos that outdates creation.
144.context: CinematicNodeContext: The player places their hand on Gale's heart. Idle.NodeContext: Gale kneels down on both knees in front of the player.

87.speaker: Gale
87.text: Even the Weave itself could not withstand the onslaught. It fractured, then shattered, and all magic was lost to the mortal realms until the day Mystra returned.
87.context: CinematicNodeContext: The player places their hand on Gale's heart. Idle.NodeContext: Gale kneels down on both knees in front of the player.

56.speaker: Gale
56.text: She restored the Weave, reuniting all its scattered shards. Or so I thought, until in the course of my studies I learned of a book. A Netherese tome in which a piece of the fractured Weave had been sealed beyond her reach.
56.context: CinematicNodeContext: The player places their hand on Gale's heart. Idle.NodeContext: Gale kneels down on both knees in front of the player.

123.speaker: Gale
123.text: 'What if', I thought, 'What if after all this time, I could return this lost part of herself to the goddess?'
123.context: CinematicNodeContext: The player places their hand on Gale's heart. Idle.NodeContext: Gale kneels down on both knees in front of the player.

27.speaker: Player
27.text: What was the answer to that question?
27.context: CinematicNodeContext: The player places their hand on Gale's heart. Idle.NodeContext: Gale kneels down on both knees in front of the player.

97.speaker: Gale
97.text: The answer was to try, and the outcome was to fail.

19.speaker: Player
19.text: I guess you ruled out flowers and chocolates altogether then.
19.context: CinematicNodeContext: The player places their hand on Gale's heart. Idle.NodeContext: Gale kneels down on both knees in front of the player.

68.speaker: Gale
68.text: You know me. My gestures can never be grand enough.

141.speaker: Player
141.text: So your grand plan was akin to emptying a cup of water in the sea. Brilliant.
141.context: CinematicNodeContext: The player places their hand on Gale's heart. Idle.NodeContext: Gale kneels down on both knees in front of the player.

0.speaker: Gale
0.text: I certainly thought so. Sometimes there is great strength to be found in symbolism.
0.context: CinematicNodeContext: The player places their hand on Gale's heart. Idle.NodeContext: Gale kneels down on both knees in front of the player.

108.speaker: Gale
108.text: I was certain that this deed of raw power draped in romance would convince Mystra to take me by the hand and welcome me into her hitherto forbidden domains.
108.context: CinematicNodeContext: The player places their hand on Gale's heart. Idle.NodeContext: Gale kneels down on both knees in front of the player.

120.speaker: Gale
120.context: CinematicNodeContext: The player places their hand on Gale's heart. Idle.NodeContext: Gale kneels down on both knees in front of the player.

28.speaker: Gale
28.text: I obtained the fabled book and took it into my study. As for what happened next...
28.context: CinematicNodeContext: The player places their hand on Gale's heart. Idle.NodeContext: Gale kneels down on both knees in front of the player.

35.text: Here. Place your hand over my heart. Let me show you.
35.context: CinematicNodeContext: The player places their hand on Gale's heart. Idle.NodeContext: Gale kneels down on both knees in front of the player.

63.speaker: Gale
63.text: Here. Place your hand over my heart. Let me show you.
63.context: CinematicNodeContext: The player places their hand on Gale's heart. Idle.NodeContext: Gale kneels down on both knees in front of the player.

137.speaker: Narrator
137.text: *You feel the tadpole quiver as you realise Gale is letting you in.*
137.context: CinematicNodeContext: In a blink Gale grabs the players hand, holding it in place. Intense Idle.

112.speaker: Narrator
112.context: CinematicNodeContext: In a blink Gale grabs the players hand, holding it in place. Intense Idle.

5.speaker: Narrator
5.text: *You see through Gale's eyes, staring down the corridors of a dread memory. A book, bound, then suddenly opened.*
5.context: InternalNodeContext: Vision not shown for EA

124.speaker: Narrator
124.text: *You see through Gale's eyes, staring down the corridors of a dread memory. A book, bound, then suddenly opened.*
124.context: InternalNodeContext: Vision not shown for EA

96.speaker: Narrator
96.text: *Inside there are no pages, only a swirling mass of blackest Weave that pounces.*
96.context: InternalNodeContext: Vision not shown for EA

50.text: *Its teeth, its claws, it's unstoppable as it digs through and becomes part of you. And gods, is it ever-hungry...*
50.context: CinematicNodeContext: The vision passes and Gale let's go of the player's hand, leaving it in place.InternalNodeContext: Vision not shown for EA

40.speaker: Narrator
40.text: *Its teeth, its claws, it's unstoppable as it digs through and becomes part of you. And gods, is it ever-hungry...*
40.context: CinematicNodeContext: The vision passes and Gale let's go of the player's hand, leaving it in place.InternalNodeContext: Vision not shown for EA

98.speaker: Player
98.text: What is it? What do you see?
98.context: CinematicNodeContext: The player takes their hand off of Gale's chest.

139.speaker: Astarion
139.text: What is it? What do you see?
139.context: CinematicNodeContext: The player takes their hand off of Gale's chest.

153.speaker: Player
153.context: CinematicNodeContext: The player takes their hand off of Gale's chest.

134.speaker: Player
134.context: CinematicNodeContext: The player takes their hand off of Gale's chest.

14.text: Terrifying isn't it? And that is only the beginning.
14.context: CinematicNodeContext: The player takes their hand off of Gale's chest.

126.speaker: Gale
126.text: Terrifying isn't it? And that is only the beginning.

93.text: This Netherese blight... this orb, for lack of a better word, is balled up inside my chest. And it needs to be fed.

122.speaker: Gale
122.text: This Netherese blight... this orb, for lack of a better word, is balled up inside my chest. And it needs to be fed.

39.speaker: Gale
39.text: As long I absorb traces of the Weave from potent enough sources, it remains quiet. Were it ever to fully destabilise, however...

85.speaker: Player
85.context: NodeContext: He admits he’s a walking disaster waiting to happen.

44.speaker: Gale
44.context: NodeContext: He admits he’s a walking disaster waiting to happen.

75.speaker: Gale
75.text: I don't know the exact magnitude of the eruption, but given my studies of Netherese magic, I'd say even a fragment as small as the one I carry...
75.context: NodeContext: He admits he’s a walking disaster waiting to happen.

151.speaker: Gale
151.text: It'd level a city the size of Waterdeep.
151.context: NodeContext: He admits he’s a walking disaster waiting to happen. This is said very seriously. The truth is finally out and he has no idea how the player will react to such monstrous news.

116.speaker: Gale
116.text: Fortunately, this need no longer be a concern. Not until I meet the Heart of the Absolute - whatever that is.

52.speaker: Player
52.text: You thrice-damned rotten bastard! You've been the greatest threat to our lives all this time!

55.speaker: Lae'zel
55.text: You thrice-damned rotten bastard! You've been the greatest threat to our lives all this time!

74.speaker: Gale
74.text: I swear to you I wasn't. But I've no choice but to admit I am now. Perhaps it would be best if I leave and put as much distance between us as I can before the orb erupts.

43.speaker: Player
43.text: Is there nothing we can do?

12.speaker: Player
12.text: Is there nothing we can do?

128.speaker: Gale
128.text: Carry out Mystra's wishes, I suppose. Though that would be a very drastic solution, if you can even call it that.

33.speaker: Gale
33.text: We might chance upon a king's collection of magical artefacts around the corner. We might cross paths with a miracle round the bend. Then again - we might not.

69.speaker: Gale
69.text: All of this... It must feel like a betrayal. Say the word, and we'll part ways.

13.speaker: Gale
13.text: I would hear what the others say first.

42.speaker: Player
42.text: I would hear what the others say first.

148.speaker: Narrator
148.text: You never know, a walking bomb could come in handy some day. I say he stays.

59.speaker: Astarion
59.text: You never know, a walking bomb could come in handy some day. I say he stays.

11.speaker: Lae'zel
11.text: Has the tadpole wrecked your senses? He must be cast out immediately.

105.speaker: Astarion
105.text: You'd have us debate? That Netherese jack-in-the-box should be a blip on the horizon by now!

24.speaker: Lae'zel
24.text: I agree. Let us be rid of this menace.

103.speaker: Wyll
103.text: Come now, have a heart. Gale is one of us, and we should stand by his side.

106.speaker: Lae'zel
106.text: You'd even consider letting him stay? We must be rid of this menace.

114.speaker: Wyll
114.text: Have a heart. Gale is one of us, and we should stand by his side.

91.speaker: Karlach
91.text: Come on. We all have our secrets - and our risks. If Gale leaves, we might as well disband completely.

70.speaker: Shadowheart
70.text: I'm in two minds - and frankly don't care a great deal. Either decision is fine by me.

37.speaker: Wyll
37.text: Gale's one of us, and we should stand by his side.

8.speaker: Karlach
8.text: Absolutely. We're all risky in our own ways. We stick together anyway. Right?

1.speaker: Karlach
1.text: If having dangerous, otherworldly objects stuck in your skin is wrong, then Gale and I both have to go. We're not really splitting up, are we?

60.speaker: Gale
60.text: I care too much about you to abandon you now, Gale. We travel on together.

95.speaker: Player
95.text: I care too much about you to abandon you now, Gale. We travel on together.

54.speaker: Player
54.text: We've come this far together and we'll continue on together. That is how it will be.

77.speaker: Gale
77.text: That is - a great relief. Oh, a great relief indeed!

84.speaker: Gale
84.text: You truly are a soul that steels my own. From all my new-rallied heart I thank you.

118.speaker: Gale
118.text: I thank you all. I understand if you stand against me. I'm humbled if you stand with me. Either way, I will do my best not to let you down.

76.speaker: Gale
76.text: I stand at a precipice, but if you do not give up hope, neither shall I. I'll fight, I'll resist - as long as I can.

2.speaker: Gale
2.text: Now - even I am tired of the sound of my own voice. Let us venture forth.

101.speaker: Player
101.text: If we were to part ways, where would you go?

78.speaker: Gale
78.text: Once I'd step out of the protective aura of the artefact, it wouldn't be long before the Absolute overtakes me. I'd never let that happen, so I'd aim for a swift end.

102.speaker: Gale
102.text: I would consume some Midnight Tears and venture as deep into the Underdark as I possibly could, until they cloud my eyes forever.

51.speaker: Gale
51.text: With a bit of luck I'd manage to make it to a mind flayer colony, so that when the orb erupts, one loud, last song of vengeance would reverberate through the dark.

136.speaker: Gale
136.text: It wouldn't be a heroic end, but coarsely poetic enough in its justice.

45.speaker: Player
45.text: You pose too grave a threat. This is goodbye, Gale.

138.speaker: Gale
138.text: I understand. I harbour you no ill will. In fact I enjoyed your company, even throughout this harrowing journey of ours.

146.speaker: Gale
146.text: My tale is at an end, but yours is not. Beat that damn parasite in your head. Win the day and celebrate the nights.

145.speaker: Player
145.text: I thought we were growing closer, Gale. You should've told me right away.

90.speaker: Player
90.text: I trusted you, Gale. You should've told me right away.

21.speaker: Player
21.text: Unbelievable. Did you ever think what would happen if the tadpole got the better of you?

132.speaker: Gale
132.text: Every waking moment. Every dreaming moment too. But there was no way out.

104.speaker: Player
104.text: By rights I should kill you.

150.speaker: Gale
150.text: Perhaps that is what I deserve, but you deserve no such thing. To kill me is to unleash the orb.

15.speaker: Player
15.text: I don't think I want to hear this.

121.speaker: Player
121.context: CinematicNodeContext: Gale removes the player's hand from his chest and stands back up.

53.speaker: Gale
53.text: Thankfully, the moment I absorbed the fragment wasn't enough to kill me outright. It was only the beginning.

94.speaker: Player
94.context: CinematicNodeContext: Gale removes the player's hand from his chest and stands back up.

62.speaker: Gale
62.text: I'm sorry, but I had to. After all, this is only the beginning.

81.speaker: Gale
81.text: I'm sorry, but I had to remind you. After all, this is only the beginning.

34.speaker: Player
34.text: All this time, I've been travelling with a monster...
34.context: CinematicNodeContext: Gale removes the player's hand from his chest and stands back up.

57.speaker: Gale
57.text: All this time, I've been travelling with you despite the tadpole in your head.
57.context: CinematicNodeContext: Gale removes the player's hand from his chest and stands back up.

86.speaker: Gale
86.text: We are none of us monsters. We are merely hatcheries for monstrous things.
86.context: CinematicNodeContext: Gale removes the player's hand from his chest and stands back up.

41.speaker: Gale
41.context: CinematicNodeContext: Gale removes the player's hand from his chest and stands back up.

147.context: CinematicNodeContext: Gale removes the player's hand from his chest and stands back up.

17.speaker: Narrator
17.text: *You've seen this before: the book, the black tendrils of chaos Weave that lash out and overtake you.*

152.speaker: Narrator
152.text: *The dread is as real as the first time - the oppression just as unbearable.*

71.speaker: Player
71.text: Your motivations, at least, were worthy of Mystra. You aimed to serve her.

79.speaker: Gale
79.text: I don't discredit my reasoning. Alas that my execution was rather less sound.

61.speaker: Player
61.text: We can go over that later. Straight to the sordid please.

131.speaker: Gale
131.text: Suffice it to say I obtained an obscure and ancient book that had locked away inside a much-coveted prize:

7.speaker: Gale
7.text: It was a fragment of primal Weave locked out of time - locked away from Mystra herself.

113.speaker: Player
113.text: You thought you knew better than Mystra? You're more a fool than I thought.

3.speaker: Gale
3.text: Though not, I think, my methods.

58.speaker: Player
58.text: That's as tantamount to heresy as a wizard can come.

38.speaker: Gale
38.text: Perhaps. But enticements beyond the perimeters of mortality are powerful motivators.

125.speaker: Player
125.text: Bold. Few would dare to reduce a goddess to their 'muse.'

119.speaker: Gale
119.text: I am, after all, the villain of the tale.

31.speaker: Player
31.text: I don't believe a word of what you're saying.

29.speaker: Gale
29.text: A mortal enchanted by the allures of the divine: is that not a tale as old as time? I merely happen to be one of its protagonists.

127.speaker: Player
127.text: It seems you and I have had quite different experiences concerning Mystra.

10.speaker: Gale
10.text: It is fair to say her intimacy is not easily won. Nevertheless, I did.
